IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDesc: TO EDUCATE USING AN APPROVED CURRICULUM.
IRS990.MissionDesc: RUMSEY HALL SCHOOL IS COMMITTED TO A WHOLE CHILD APPROACH TO EDUCATION AND BELIEVES THAT TEACHING ACADEMICS AND TEACHING AN ATTITUDE OF MIND ARE OF EQUAL IMPORTANCE.THE SCHOOL EMPHASIZES EFFORT AS A CRITERION FOR SUCCESS AND IS DEDICATED TO HELPING EACH CHILD DEVELOP TOWARDS HIS OR HER MAXIMUM STATURE AS AN EDUCATED PERSON, A SUCCESSFUL MEMBER OF A FAMILY, AND A CONTRIBUTING MEMBER OF THE COMMUNITY.
IRS990.Desc: RUMSEY HALL SCHOOL IS A COED BOARDING AND COUNTRY DAY INDEPENDENT SCHOOL PROVIDING EDUCATIONAL INSTRUCTION TO STUDENTS IN GRADES KINDERGARTEN THROUGH NINE.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: SCHEDULE D, PAGE 4, PART XI, LINE 4B
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: DIRECT RENTAL EXPENSE OFFSET AGAINST RENTAL INCOME ON 990 -83,895 REALIZED LOSSESS ON SECURITIES -290,044

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: SCHEDULE D, PAGE 4, PART XII, LINE 2D
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: DIRECT RENTAL EXPENSE OFFSET AGAINST RENTAL INCOME ON 990 83,895 REALIZED LOSSES ON SALE OF SECURITIES 290,044
THE NONDISCRIMINATION POLICY HAS BEEN PUBLICIZED MAINLY THROUGH NEWSPAPERS ADVERTISEMENTS AND SCHOOL BROCHURES.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: SCHEDULE J, PAGE 1, PART I, LINE 1A
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE HEADMASTER IS PROVIDED HOUSING ON CAMPUS FOR THE SCHOOL'S CONVENIEMCE.

RUMSEY HALL SCHOOL IS COMMITTED TO A WHOLE CHILD APPROACH TO EDUCATION AND BELIEVES THAT TEACHING ACADEMICS AND TEACHING AN ATTITUDE OF MIND ARE OF EQUAL IMPORTANCE.THE SCHOOL EMPHASIZES EFFORT AS A CRITERION FOR SUCCESS AND IS DEDICATED TO HELPING EACH CHILD DEVELOP TOWARDS HIS OR HER MAXIMUM STATURE AS AN EDUCATED PERSON, A SUCCESSFUL MEMBER OF A FAMILY, AND A CONTRIBUTING MEMBER OF THE COMMUNITY.
A COPY OF FORM 990 IS SENT TO THE CHAIRMAN OF THE FINANCE COMMITTEE FOR REVIEW. ANY AND ALL QUESTIONS ARE ANSWERED BEFORE FILING.

AT THE JUNE BOARD MEETING THE BOARD MEMBERS & STAFF ARE ASKED TO REVIEW AND MAKE SURE THEY ARE STILL IN COMPLIANCE WITH THE WRITTEN CONFLICT OF INTEREST POLICY. ALTHOUGH NO FORMAL SYSTEM HAS BEEN SET UP TO MONITOR COMPLIANCE IT HAS BECOME A CONSIDERATION IN ALL ACTIVITIES OF THE SCHOOL.

AT THE ANNUAL JUNE BOARD MEETING, THE BOARD REVIEWS THE COMPENSATION OF THE HEADMASTER, THE SCHOOL'S CEO/EXECUTIVE DIRECTOR. THE BOARD USES HISTORICAL COMPENSATION INFORMATION, THE NAIS BENCHMARKING COMPENSATION REPORT, AND THE HEADMASTER'S PERFORMANCE IN ORDER TO DETERMINE THE ANNUAL COMPENSATION. ALL SPREADSHEETS, RELEVANT REPORTS, AND THE WRITTEN AND SIGNED CONTRACT ARE FILED IN THE PERSONNEL FILE OF THE HEADMASTER.

AN ANNUAL PERFORMANCE REVIEW IS CONDUCTED FOR ALL CORPORATE OFFICERS THAT ARE ALSO EMPLOYEES. THE RESULTS OF THIS REVIEW, CONDUCTED BY ONE'S SUPERVISOR, ALONG WITH COMPARABILITY DATA AND HISTORICAL COMPENSATION DETERMINE THE NEW CONTRACTUAL COMPENSATION. A SIGNED WRITTEN CONTRACT IS THEN FILED IN THE PERSONNEL FILE.
THE GOVERNING DOCUMENTS, CONFLICT OF INTEREST POLICY, AND FINANCIAL STATEMENTS ARE MADE AVAILABLE TO THE PUBLIC UPON REQUEST.
